intro: Parosela sericea, commonly known as the silky parosela, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a silky appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Parosela sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
